name: Green Mesa
body:
## Hyperbone

Hyperbone is a non-framework framework, built on [Backbone.js](http://backbonejs.org/), for building client side applications consuming [JSON HAL](http://stateless.co/hal_specification.html). 

By 'Non-Framework', we mean that each component is distributed via the [Component package manager](https://github.com/component/component). Use one or all of the components as you see fit. 

Activity on this project is high at the moment. We hope to get a fully annotated demo application up and running soon.

### [Hyperbone Model](https://github.com/green-mesa/hyperbone-model)

Backbone models with Hypermedia extensions

### [Hyperbone View](https://github.com/green-mesa/hyperbone-view)

Bind Hyperbone Models to the DOM, with special Hypermedia conventions.

### [Hyperbone Form](https://github.com/green-mesa/hyperbone-form)

Generate styleable two-way bound HTML Forms from JSON `_controls` in your Hypermedia documents.

### TODO: Hyperbone IO

HyperboneIO deals with network interactions for Hypermedia documents - loading, reloading and sending `_controls` data to the server. 

### TODO: Hyperbone App

Routing and bringing all the others together with some helpful conventions to all the actual building of apps.

### TODO: Hyperbone Build

Component is a great package manager, but the build tool adds a significant file size overhead when dealing with a large number of Components. Hyperbone Build allows you to use Component as your package manager and compile your source as a self-bootstrapping application with minimal module related detritus. 

## Backbone 

We have broken Backbone into discrete standalone modules so that Hyperbone can avoid loading unnecessary parts.

We have:

- [Backbone Events](https://github.com/green-mesa/backbone-events)
- [Backbone Model](https://github.com/green-mesa/backbone-model)
- [Backbone Collection](https://github.com/green-mesa/backbone-collection)
- [Backbone Sync](https://github.com/green-mesa/backbone-sync) - Warning: Also installs jQuery. Yikes.
